content: Does anyone have time to have a look at #13885 ? I've had some comments already on this, but it still needs to be looked at by someone who can approve the PR. Its the first part of the larger PR #13500 which has this uniform limit of holomorphic functions stuff.
I'll take a look now. It's possible I won't be able to make a call but let's see how I do.
(I got distracted but just did a quick review, I will aim to respond to your feedback without too much delay since you've been waiting some time already)
I just had another quick look at this PR and added another remark. I've marked it as "awaiting-author" for now but I'll pick it up again once the points I've raised have been addressed.
Thank you, I'm just looking at them now!

OK I've done pretty much all of the first round of changes. The only thing I've not done is remove r from circle_integral_transform_deriv_bound. It seems annoying to do and I'm not sure if the gains are worth it? But maybe I'm being silly and there is a quick way to do this.

I'll take a look again later today. IIRC the point about dropping r was that the simpler statement (without r) implied the more complicated one trivially so I'll probably just repeat my suggestion there.

However as I say, I'll look again later today.

I'm afraid I only got to look at this PR rather late in the day. I still think you should drop the r argument. I've just opened a very small PR to help:
(+10, -0) #14627 feat(topology/metric_space/basic): add lemma exists_lt_mem_ball_of_mem_ball
which I'd love to see resolved quickly so as not to block you.
I'll hope to have time to look in more detail this evening.
Oh awesome thanks! I'll have a go at removing 'r' later today or tomorrow.
Ok I think all of the changes have been made, so if anyone can have a look that would be great, thanks!
